bow: is ppd legitimate reason for not breastfeeding breastfeeding has picked back up in popularity which is wonderful however have met some really nosy and judgmental moms recently start to mix bottle for my son and they immediately jump in and ask why not breastfeeding and if breastfed my year old son here the thing after my oldest was born had severe ppd had the best of intentions to breastfeed he was nearly 10 lbs when he was born and wanted to be latched all the time it did help that he had acid reflux so he was really crabby all the time anyway after few days of attempting to breastfeed began to resent him every time he was hungry did not feel like had bonded or connected with my baby at all my husband suggested try formula with the first bottle it was like sigh of relief couple months later ended up getting on medication for few months until my hormones leveled out never did breastfeed him more than those first couple days when my second son was born will admit it did even try had prenatal depression which turned into full blown ppd about 24 hours after the baby was born and immediately started medication when try to somewhat explain this to women who ask why not
